intro: Baeothryon uniflorum, commonly known as the single-flower baeothryon, is a small, annual herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces a single, showy flower that is usually pale blue or purple in color. Its leaves are narrow and linear, adapted to reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Baeothryon uniflorum is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
